content.raw:
I noticed for tunnel\_circuit\_practice\_02 that the artifact origin defined in the tunnel\_circuit\_practice\_02\_gz.world file and the reported artifact origin offset from the /subt/pose\_from\_artifact\_origin seem inconsistent. 

At start, the service returns 

> ORIGIN OFFSET: header:  
> seq: 0  
> stamp: 10.732000000  
> frame\_id: artifact\_origin  
> pose:  
> position:  
> x: -6  
> y: 5  
> z: 0.0614999  
> orientation:  
> x: -5.61681e-11  
> y: 1.16108e-08  
> z: -6.95367e-18  
> w: 1

While the artifact origin in the world file is defined as 

```
<include>
  <name>artifact_origin</name>
  <pose>2 4 0.5 0 0 0</pose>
  <uri>model://fiducial</uri>
</include>
```

‌

The position offset is the same as I receive for other tunnels, such as simple\_tunnel\_02, which has an artifact origin of 10,0,0. If the world artifact origin is set at a different location, should not the artifact origin pose be different?  Could this potentially affect scoring?
content.html:
I noticed for tunnel_circuit_practice_02 that the artifact origin defined in the tunnel_circuit_practice_02_gz.world file and the reported artifact origin offset from the /subt/pose_from_artifact_origin seem inconsistent.

At start, the service returns

ORIGIN OFFSET: header:
seq: 0
stamp: 10.732000000
frame_id: artifact_origin
pose:
position:
x: -6
y: 5
z: 0.0614999
orientation:
x: -5.61681e-11
y: 1.16108e-08
z: -6.95367e-18
w: 1

While the artifact origin in the world file is defined as 

<include>
  <name>artifact_origin</name>
  <pose>2 4 0.5 0 0 0</pose>
  <uri>model://fiducial</uri>
</include>

‌

The position offset is the same as I receive for other tunnels, such as simple_tunnel_02, which has an artifact origin of 10,0,0. If the world artifact origin is set at a different location, should not the artifact origin pose be different? Could this potentially affect scoring?
